Condition : 1 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Drawing no: 2015/1270/4 (Location Plan, Existing and Proposed Block Plan) Dated 4 2015 
Drawing no: 2015/1270/1Rev A (Existing Ground Floor Plan And Existing First Floor Plan) Dated 10 2016. 
Drawing no: 2015/1270/5Rev A (Existing Secon Floor Plan and Existing Roof Plan) Dated 10 2016. 
Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) Valid Until 26 March 2031
DOMESTIC ELECTRICAL INSTALLATION CONDITION REPORT SERIAL NUMBER 23397073 Dated 17/05/2021 
Assured Shorthold Tenancy Date 07 June 2019 
A Signed Statutory Deceleration on the 19th November 2024 by the Applicant has been submitted as Evidence.
Residents/Occupiers  in this One - Bedroom Confirmed in a Letter dated 17th Nov 2024 for occupying this Flat since  June 2019  
Covering letter Ref: IC/2993 Dated November 2024

Condition : 2 - The Local Planning Authority is satisfied that at the time the application was made the use had been subsisting for a period of no less than 4 years ending with the date of the application.

Condition : 3 - The Local Planning Authority is satisfied that at the time the application was made the use had been subsisting for a period of no less than 10 years ending with the date of the application.

Condition : 4 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay.
